JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sought an increase of the maintenance payments from her ex - husband before the ORG . On DATE she complained to the President of the ORG about undue delays in the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE she was informed that her complaint had been transmitted to the ORG where the case file had been transferred by a decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the President of the ORG informed the applicant that her complaint would be dealt with after an expert had returned the case file .

CARDINAL . On DATE the President of the ORG informed the applicant that the case file concerning the maintenance dispute had been erroneously attached to the file in separate proceedings concerning her ex - husband 's contact with their son . The latter proceedings had also been initiated before ORG and the case file had been transferred to PERSON , for reasons of local jurisdiction , by a decision of DATE . The President of the ORG noted that the maintenance dispute had not been duly transferred to his court and instructed the judge dealing with the case “ to take immediate measures ” .

CARDINAL . In view of the statements of the Presidents of the PERSON I and ORG , on DATE the applicant complained of undue delays before ORG . The applicant directed her constitutional complaint against the ORG where , according to the information from the President of ORG , the case file had been transferred in DATE . The applicant did not indicate the file number under which the proceedings had been pending before LAW as no number had been assigned to the case at that time .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG invited the applicant to indicate the file number of the proceedings before GPE . On DATE the applicant 's representative obtained the requested information and forwarded it by telephone to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the applicant 's complaint concerning delays in the proceedings before the ORG admissible .

CARDINAL . On DATE the President of the ORG informed ORG in writing that the case file concerning the proceedings complained of had been returned ( as erroneously attached to another file ) to ORG on DATE . The letter further stated that on DATE the ORG had formally re - transferred the case file to ORG .
CARDINAL . At the same time , the applicant unsuccessfully attempted to amend her constitutional complaint as formally directed also against the Košice I District Court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that the applicant 's right to a hearing without undue delays had not been violated by the Košice II District Court . ORG stated that it was bound by the formulation of the complaint and by its decision on admissibility and could examine the length of proceedings complaint only in respect of the proceedings before LAW where the case file had been duly transferred on DATE . Although the conduct of the ORG fell outside the scope of the complaint examined by ORG , the latter noted that the maintenance proceedings had lasted an unreasonably long time and that undue delay had occurred before the PERSON I ORG .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the ORG delivered a judgment which became final on DATE .
